speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: SCENE V. Gloucester's castle.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enter CORNWALL and EDMUND

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I will have my revenge ere I depart his house.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: How, my lord, I may be censured, that nature thus

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: gives way to loyalty, something fears me to think

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I now perceive, it was not altogether your

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: brother's evil disposition made him seek his death;

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: but a provoking merit, set a-work by a reprovable

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: badness in himself.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: How malicious is my fortune, that I must repent to

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: be just! This is the letter he spoke of, which

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: approves him an intelligent party to the advantages

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of France: O heavens! that this treason were not,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: or not I the detector!

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: o with me to the duchess.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: If the matter of this paper be certain, you have

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: mighty business in hand.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: True or false, it hath made thee earl of

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Gloucester. Seek out where thy father is, that he

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: may be ready for our apprehension.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: [Aside]  If I find him comforting the king, it will

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: stuff his suspicion more fully.--I will persevere in

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: my course of loyalty, though the conflict be sore

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: between that and my blood.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: I will lay trust upon thee; and thou shalt find a

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: dearer father in my love.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Exeunt
